intro: Syngonanthus anthemidiflorus var. similis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact growth habit and yellow flowers. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like blooms that attract pollinators. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Syngonanthus anthemidiflorus var. similis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing soil in dry environments.
